_comment: Created by rreed on 20/02/2017 12:58:30 using v2.7
title: How many elective operations have been cancelled and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary:
The number of cancelled elective operations fluctuates over time from quarter to quarter, but in any given year there are peaks in Q4. This is likely due to hospitals dealing with winter pressures.

However, there is an increasing trend in the number of cancelled elective operations. There were 9,375 more cancelled elective operation in Q3 2016/17 (21,249) than Q3 1994/95 (11,874) - a 79% increase.

Updated January 2017.
